FileKit

public class FileKit

Utility providing path resolution and execution environment information

Absolute Path Resolution
  • executableFolder

    Absolute path to the executable’s folder

    Declaration

    Swift

    public static let executableFolder: String = executableFolderURL.path
  • projectFolder

    Absolute path to the project’s root folder

    Declaration

    Swift

    public static let projectFolder: String = projectFolderURL.path
  • workingDirectory

    Absolute path to the present working directory (PWD)

    Declaration

    Swift

    public static let workingDirectory: String = workingDirectoryURL.path

Absolute URL Path Resolution
  • workingDirectoryURL

    Provides the standardized working directory accounting for environmental changes. When running in Xcode, this returns the directory containing the Package.swift of the project while outside returns the current working directory

    Declaration

    Swift

    public static let workingDirectoryURL: URL = { () -> URL in
  • executableURL

    This URL points to the executable

    Declaration

    Swift

    public static let executableURL: URL = { () -> URL in
  • executableFolderURL

    Directory containing the executable of the project, or, if run from inside Xcode, the /.build/debug folder in the project’s root folder.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public static let executableFolderURL: URL = { () -> URL in
  • projectFolderURL

    Directory containing the Package.swift of the project (as determined by traversing up the directory structure starting at the directory containing the executable), or if no Package.swift is found then the directory containing the executable

    Declaration

    Swift

    public static let projectFolderURL: URL = { () -> URL in
